get.summary: Get a list of all available REST API operations.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

200.description: The list of available REST API operations.

schema.title: List of available REST API operations

value.description: Array of available REST API operations.

items.title: Operation supported by the resource provider.

name.description: The name of the operation being performed on this particular object.

display.description: The localized display information for this particular operation or action.

resource.description: Resource on which the operation is performed.

operation.description: Human-readable, friendly name for the operation.

description.example: Gets monitors and their current health state

origin.description: The intended executor of the operation.

nextLink.description: Link to next page if the list is too long.

get.summary: Get the current health status of all monitors of a virtual machine. Optional parameters: $expand (retrieve the monitor's evidence and configuration) and $filter (filter by monitor name).

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The subscription Id of the virtual machine.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The resource group of the virtual machine.

parameters.name: providerName
parameters.description: The provider name (ex: Microsoft.Compute for virtual machines).

parameters.name: resourceCollectionName
parameters.description: The resource collection name (ex: virtualMachines for virtual machines).

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: The name of the virtual machine.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Optionally filter by monitor name. Example: $filter=monitorName eq 'logical-disks|C:|disk-free-space-mb.'

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Optionally expand the monitor’s evidence and/or configuration. Example: $expand=evidence,configuration.

200.description: The health monitors matching the specified criteria.

schema.title: Information about the current health statuses of the monitors.

value.description: Array of health monitors of the virtual machine.

items.title: Information about the monitor’s current health status.

properties.description: Properties of the monitor's health status.

monitoredObject.description: Dynamic monitored object of the monitor.

previousMonitorState.description: Previous health state of the monitor.
previousMonitorState.title: One of health states - healthy, critical, warning, unknown, none, disabled.

currentMonitorState.description: Current health state of the monitor.
currentMonitorState.title: One of health states - healthy, critical, warning, unknown, none, disabled.

evaluationTimestamp.description: Timestamp of the monitor's last health evaluation.

currentStateFirstObservedTimestamp.description: Timestamp of the monitor's last health state change.

lastReportedTimestamp.description: Timestamp of the monitor's last reported health state.

evidence.description: Evidence validating the monitor's current health state.

monitorConfiguration.description: The configuration settings at the time of the monitor's health evaluation.

nextLink.description: Link to next page if the list is too long.

get.summary: Get the current health status of a monitor of a virtual machine. Optional parameter: $expand (retrieve the monitor's evidence and configuration).

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The subscription Id of the virtual machine.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The resource group of the virtual machine.

parameters.name: providerName
parameters.description: The provider name (ex: Microsoft.Compute for virtual machines).

parameters.name: resourceCollectionName
parameters.description: The resource collection name (ex: virtualMachines for virtual machines).

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: The name of the virtual machine.

parameters.name: monitorId
parameters.description: The monitor Id of the virtual machine.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Optionally expand the monitor’s evidence and/or configuration. Example: $expand=evidence,configuration.

200.description: The health monitor matching the specified criteria.

schema.title: Information about the monitor’s current health status.

properties.description: Properties of the monitor's health status.

monitoredObject.description: Dynamic monitored object of the monitor.

previousMonitorState.description: Previous health state of the monitor.
previousMonitorState.title: One of health states - healthy, critical, warning, unknown, none, disabled.

currentMonitorState.description: Current health state of the monitor.
currentMonitorState.title: One of health states - healthy, critical, warning, unknown, none, disabled.

evaluationTimestamp.description: Timestamp of the monitor's last health evaluation.

currentStateFirstObservedTimestamp.description: Timestamp of the monitor's last health state change.

lastReportedTimestamp.description: Timestamp of the monitor's last reported health state.

evidence.description: Evidence validating the monitor's current health state.

monitorConfiguration.description: The configuration settings at the time of the monitor's health evaluation.

get.summary: Get the health state changes of a monitor of a virtual machine within the provided time window (default is the last 24 hours). Optional parameters: $expand (retrieve the monitor's evidence and configuration) and $filter (filter by heartbeat condition).

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The subscription Id of the virtual machine.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The resource group of the virtual machine.

parameters.name: providerName
parameters.description: The provider name (ex: Microsoft.Compute for virtual machines).

parameters.name: resourceCollectionName
parameters.description: The resource collection name (ex: virtualMachines for virtual machines).

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: The name of the virtual machine.

parameters.name: monitorId
parameters.description: The monitor Id of the virtual machine.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Optionally filter by heartbeat condition. Example: $filter=isHeartbeat eq false.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Optionally expand the monitor’s evidence and/or configuration. Example: $expand=evidence,configuration.

parameters.name: startTimestampUtc
parameters.description: The start of the time window.

parameters.name: endTimestampUtc
parameters.description: The end of the time window.

200.description: The health monitor state changes matching the specified criteria.

schema.title: Information about the health state changes of the monitor within the provided time window.

value.description: Array of health state changes within the specified time window.

items.title: Information about the monitor’s health state change at the provided timestamp.

properties.description: Properties of the monitor's state change.

monitoredObject.description: Dynamic monitored object of the monitor.

evaluationTimestamp.description: Timestamp of the monitor's last health evaluation.

currentStateFirstObservedTimestamp.description: Timestamp of the monitor's last health state change.

previousMonitorState.description: Previous health state of the monitor.
previousMonitorState.title: One of health states - healthy, critical, warning, unknown, none, disabled.

currentMonitorState.description: Current health state of the monitor.
currentMonitorState.title: One of health states - healthy, critical, warning, unknown, none, disabled.

evidence.description: Evidence validating the monitor's current health state.

monitorConfiguration.description: The configuration settings at the time of the monitor's health evaluation.

nextLink.description: Link to next page if the list is too long.

get.summary: Get the health state change of a monitor of a virtual machine at the provided timestamp. Optional parameter: $expand (retrieve the monitor's evidence and configuration).

parameters.name: api-version

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The subscription Id of the virtual machine.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The resource group of the virtual machine.

parameters.name: providerName

parameters.name: resourceCollectionName

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: The name of the virtual machine.

parameters.name: monitorId
parameters.description: The monitor Id of the virtual machine.

parameters.name: timestampUnix
parameters.description: The timestamp of the state change (unix format).

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Optionally expand the monitor’s evidence and/or configuration. Example: $expand=evidence,configuration.

200.description: The health monitor state change matching the specified criteria.

evidence.description: Evidence validating the monitor's current health state.
